title: What is your favourite rock and roll? - Quora

response.answer_text: My favourite rock n roll type is what Queen makes  These guys are just phenomenal. Each of the member has a number one song to his name. They are great live, The best in the live concerts according to me. Their performance at 1985 love aid is still considered as the best concert ever. Their versatility is what makes go bits over this band. Just give their songs a try. And also listen to their underrated songs. The list of songs everybody should listen to understand are given below. The show must go on : The most epic song the kingdom of rock n roll has given us. Freddie's voice still raises goosebumps in me.You take my breath away: This song is only Freddie playing the piano and singing out to his loved but alone. No other members are with him. A truly hauntingly beautiful song.Its late: This is my favourite. I intend to play it on my first gig. It has a great guitar riff, couple with Freddie's awesome voice and John's fantastic bass work.39 : D. Brian May at his lyrical best. The song is a study in time and space but with all the live of home in it.

I don't really have just one favourite, just good music with 60s Garage & Soul, 70s Punk and Protopunk or 80s & Jazz & Alternative Rock featuring a lot. Time is like a music sieve and remembers the good stuff which is not always necessarily the popular stuff. 20s Louis Armstrong & the Carter Family 30s Swing, Duke Ellington, Billie Holiday & Django Reinhardt 40s BeBop Jazz, traditional Jazz, vocal Jazz 50s Hard Bop, Rock & Roll, Rockabilly 60s Garage, Psych, Tropicalia, Free Jazz, Deep Soul, Motown & Stax, Northern Soul, Beatles & Stones, French Pop, Velvet Underground, Folk, Trojan Ska 70s Punk, Protopunk, Disco, New Wave, Pub Rock, Hard Rock, Classic Metal, Glam, Komische Music, Irish Folk, ECM & Muse Jazz Labels, lsland records, Funk, High Life, Reggae 80s Post Punk, Indie, Alternative Rock, Hardcore, old school Hip Hop, Electro Pop, House, Detroit Techno 90s Grunge, Trip Hop, Shoe Gaze, Noise, Lo-Fi, Underground Hip Hop, Industrial 2000s Hard Rock, Madlib, Nu Garage, Turntablism, indie rock

I have lots of favorites: The Stones, Aerosmith, The Goo Goo Dolls, Ozzie Osbourne, Fleetwood Mac, Tom Petty, Prince, Guns n Roses, Poison, The Black Crows, Styx, Journey, Bon Jovi, Lenny Kravitz, CCR, Lynyrd Skynyrd, Phil Collins, Eric Clapton, Collective Soul, Alice in Chains, Sound Garden, Stone Temple Pilots, Led Zeppelin, Velvet Revolver, Def Leopard, The Eagles, Nickelback, REM There are SO many more!

I would choose garage rock bands from the 1960’s. They were the precursors to the punk rock movement and were made up of indie bands who were just starting out to make their own sound. Sometimes they would cover other bands and they would also do their own material. It was a musical genre which was unique in the energy and creativity by the bands that made up that movement.

Pink Floyd (not the really early psychedelic stuff, but everything from Animals on); also Queen, Metallica (up through Reload), Rush, Black Sabbath, the Eagles, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Pearl Jam, Linkin Park.
Hands down pink floyd and the Beatles and led zeppelin.
rock and roll my favorite steel panther
